episodeTitle: A Man of Mystery Appears!? His Name is Sogeking!
episodeTitleJapanese: 謎の男登場！？その名はそげキング！
episodeTitleRomanized: Nazo no otoko tōjō!? Sono na wa Sogekingu!
description: Usopp arrives in disguise as Sogeking, a mysterious masked hero who performs his own theme song. Though Sanji and Franky recognize him, they respect his choice to maintain anonymity while helping rescue Robin. Meanwhile, Nami shows off her upgraded Perfect Clima-Tact weapon on the Rocketman, and Sanji prepares to battle the eccentric chef Wanze on the Puffing Tom.

events.title: Sogeking's Grand Entrance
events.description: Usopp arrives in disguise as Sogeking, a mysterious masked hero wearing a golden mask and red cape. He introduces himself to Sanji and Franky on top of the Puffing Tom train, maintaining his secret identity despite both of them recognizing him immediately.
events.significance: This marks Usopp's return to help the crew rescue Robin, albeit in disguise due to his pride after leaving the crew. Sogeking becomes an iconic alternate persona for Usopp throughout the Enies Lobby arc and beyond.

quotes.text: Lock-on! I am the sniper of the sea, Sogeking!
quotes.speaker: Sogeking
quotes.context: Sogeking's first introduction to Sanji and Franky

quotes.speaker: Franky
quotes.context: Franky immediately recognizing Usopp in disguise, but Sanji signals him to play along

events.title: Sogeking's Theme Song Performance
events.description: Sogeking performs his iconic theme song 'Sogeking's (Hero) Song' with accompanying animation that parodies classic Toei superhero show openings. The song includes the famous 'Lu lu la la lu' refrain and declares he is from 'Sniper Island' in your heart.
events.significance: This becomes one of the most memorable and beloved moments in One Piece, with the Sogeking theme becoming a fan-favorite song that represents Usopp's courage and determination to help his friends despite his pride.

quotes.text: Lu lu la la lu... Lock-on! Sogeking! Sogege, Soge Sogeking!
quotes.speaker: Sogeking
quotes.context: The iconic refrain from Sogeking's theme song

quotes.text: I come from Sniper Island... it's in your heart!
quotes.speaker: Sogeking
quotes.context: Revealing the mystical location of Sniper Island

events.title: Nami Reveals the Perfect Clima-Tact
events.description: On the Rocketman, Nami shows off her upgraded weapon, the Perfect Clima-Tact, which Usopp modified with Dials from Skypiea before he left the crew. The weapon is significantly more powerful than her original Clima-Tact.
events.significance: This demonstrates that despite leaving the crew, Usopp still cared about his nakama and improved Nami's weapon to help protect her. It also shows the lasting impact of the Skypiea adventure through the incorporation of Dial technology.

quotes.text: It's the Perfect Clima-Tact that Usopp modified before he left.
quotes.speaker: Nami
quotes.context: Explaining her new weapon to Zoro and the others

events.title: Strategy Meeting on the Puffing Tom
events.description: Sanji, Franky, and Sogeking devise a plan to detach the rear train cars and fight their way through the government agents to reach Robin. Sanji explains to Franky that Usopp has too much pride to show his face to the crew but still wants to help save Robin.
events.significance: This shows the crew's tactical thinking and demonstrates the unspoken bond between the Straw Hats, with Sanji respecting Usopp's choice to maintain his disguise while still recognizing his friend's dedication to rescuing Robin.

quotes.text: Usopp has too much pride to show his face to the rest of the crew, but he still wants to help save Robin.
quotes.speaker: Sanji
quotes.context: Explaining Sogeking's true identity to Franky

events.title: Wanze and His Ramen Kenpo
events.description: Sanji, Franky, and Sogeking encounter Wanze, a CP7 agent and eccentric chef who uses Ramen Kenpo martial arts. Wanze creates ramen noodles from his own body by eating flour and using his nose hairs to cut the dough.
events.significance: Introduces a unique and bizarre fighting style that parodies cooking techniques. Wanze serves as Sanji's opponent, creating a chef vs. chef battle.

quotes.text: To rescue Robin, you must defeat my Ramen Kenpo!
quotes.speaker: Wanze
quotes.context: Challenging the Straw Hats with his bizarre martial art

events.title: Sanji vs. Wanze Begins
events.description: Sanji volunteers to stay behind and fight Wanze while Franky and Sogeking proceed forward through the train. The battle between the two chefs begins as Wanze demonstrates his unusual Ramen Kenpo techniques.
events.significance: Sets up the upcoming battle between Sanji and Wanze, showcasing Sanji's willingness to handle obstacles so his allies can advance toward Robin.

quotes.text: Go on ahead, I'll deal with this guy.
quotes.speaker: Sanji
quotes.context: Sanji volunteering to fight Wanze alone

events.title: Captain T-Bone's Pursuit
events.description: Captain T-Bone, a Marine Captain known as 'Ship-Cutter' T-Bone, appears pursuing Sanji, Franky, and Sogeking on the train. He uses his sword technique Chokkaku Senko: Bone Soir to slice through the train door and climbs to the roof to chase them.
events.significance: Introduces a competent Marine swordsman who poses a legitimate threat to the rescue team, adding another layer of opposition beyond the CP agents.

quotes.speaker: T-Bone
quotes.context: T-Bone preparing to cut through the train car door with his sword technique

events.title: Train Car Detachment Plan
events.description: The trio executes their plan to detach the rear train cars, separating themselves from some of the pursuing government agents and Marines while they advance toward the front cars where Robin is being held.
events.significance: Shows the strategic thinking of the rescue team and creates a dynamic action sequence as they fight while literally cutting off their escape route.

events.title: Outfit Changes on the Rocketman
events.description: Back on the Rocketman, Luffy, Zoro, Nami, and Chopper receive new outfit changes as they prepare for the assault on Enies Lobby. The crew prepares mentally and physically for the upcoming rescue mission.
events.significance: Marks the crew's preparation for one of their most important battles, showing them gearing up and ready to face the World Government to save Robin.

quotes.text: Lock-on! I am the sniper of the sea, Sogeking!
quotes.speaker: Sogeking (Usopp)

quotes.text: Lu lu la la lu... Lock-on! Sogeking! Sogege, Soge Sogeking!
quotes.speaker: Sogeking (Usopp)
quotes.context: The iconic Sogeking theme song refrain

quotes.text: Usopp has too much pride to show his face to the rest of the crew, but he still wants to help save Robin.
quotes.speaker: Sanji
quotes.context: Explaining Sogeking's true identity to Franky

quotes.text: It's the Perfect Clima-Tact that Usopp modified before he left.
quotes.speaker: Nami

themes.description: Usopp's appearance as Sogeking demonstrates how he balances his pride (refusing to directly rejoin the crew after his fight with Luffy) with his love for his nakama (still helping them rescue Robin).
themes.symbolism: The Sogeking mask represents Usopp's ability to overcome his personal conflicts while maintaining his sense of self-worth.

themes.description: Sanji and Franky immediately recognize Usopp but respect his choice to maintain the Sogeking persona, showing that true friendship means accepting each other's needs and boundaries.
themes.symbolism: The unspoken agreement to play along with Sogeking's identity represents the deep understanding between crew members.

themes.description: Both groups (on the Puffing Tom and the Rocketman) prepare for the upcoming conflicts, strategizing and equipping themselves for the rescue mission.
themes.symbolism: The new outfits and upgraded weapons symbolize the crew's evolution and readiness to face greater challenges.

characterSpotlights.development: Usopp returns to help the crew as Sogeking, showing his growth in finding a way to help his friends while maintaining his pride. His theme song and superhero persona showcase his creativity and determination.
keyActions: Arrives as Sogeking with dramatic entrance
Joins Sanji and Franky in planning the rescue strategy
Maintains his disguise despite being recognized
quotes: Lock-on! I am the sniper of the sea, Sogeking!
Lu lu la la lu... Lock-on! Sogeking!

characterSpotlights.development: Sanji demonstrates his tactical mind and emotional intelligence by understanding Usopp's situation and respecting his choice to appear as Sogeking. He also shows his dedication by volunteering to fight Wanze alone.
keyActions: Recognizes Usopp immediately but plays along
Devises strategy to detach train cars
quotes: Usopp has too much pride to show his face to the rest of the crew, but he still wants to help save Robin.

characterSpotlights.development: Nami displays her upgraded Perfect Clima-Tact, showing the lasting connection with Usopp through the weapon he improved for her before leaving.
keyActions: Explains Usopp's contribution to her weapon
Prepares for battle with new outfit
quotes: It's the Perfect Clima-Tact that Usopp modified before he left.

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extended the Sogeking theme song sequence with elaborate animation parodying Toei's tokusatsu superhero shows, which was not present in the manga.
The anime added more comedic reactions from Franky and Sanji to Sogeking's introduction and theme song.

trivia.fact: The Sogeking theme song became one of the most beloved songs in One Piece, with many fans requesting it to return in later arcs. It eventually returned in Episode 1015 during the Wano Arc.
The Sogeking animation sequence parodies the opening sequences of classic Toei tokusatsu shows, particularly Kamen Rider X and Kamen Rider Stronger.
In the Funimation dub, Sogeking's name was changed to 'Sniper King' and the theme song was re-recorded in English by Sonny Strait (Usopp's voice actor).
This episode adapted chapters 368-369 of the manga and aired on March 5, 2006 in Japan with an 11.4% TV viewership rating.
The Perfect Clima-Tact incorporates Dials that Usopp obtained during the Skypiea Arc, making it significantly more powerful than the original Clima-Tact.
